discharge_summary: problem: high-risk burkitt-like lymphoma stage iv infiltration mo diagnosis 2020 right neck mass nasopharyngeal renal lesions, cervical lymph node biopsy 05/22: morphological and immunohistochemical picture of b-cell lymphoma, with small, intermediate-sized cells and high proliferative index. immunohistochemistry: positivity for cd20, pax5, weak cd10, bcl6. negativity for cd34, tdt, bcl2, cmyc, ki67 of 95 100%. cd3 evidenced the population of reactive t lymphocytes. cmyc negativity rules out the diagnosis of burkitt's lymphoma. the present case may correspond to burkittlike lymphoma with 11q aberration nasopharyngeal mass biopsy 05/26: b lymphoma with high mitotic index cerebrospinal fluid puncture 06/05: no bmo infiltration 06/03/2020: diffusely infiltrated by b lymphoma with high mitotic index. cd19 / cd 20 / cd10 / bcl 6 if de mo 06/04: cd 19 / cd 20 / cd10 / cd 43 / cd 81 / lambda collection of material for semen cryopreservation 06/05/2020 ecog 0. admission: 13/08/2020, discharge: 08/21/2020, stay: 07 d 22 h, location: ward, payer: sus. [person] diagnosed with Burkitt's lymphoma was admitted to the hospital for a second cycle of Rivac D1: 14/08/2020. On 08/16, D3 of the second Rivac, he had a fever peak of 38.1 °C, which lasted for about 1 hour. He reported nausea and had had 3 episodes of bowel movements with softer stools on the day in question. He also had a blood count on the day with 2,000 neutrophils, but already falling, with a tendency towards neutropenia. Given this, the condition was managed as febrile neutropenia, with a probable abdominal focus of infection. It was decided to start cefepime and metronidazole. He underwent a chest CT scan without changes, and a CT scan of the sinuses with evidence of content in the frontal sinus and mastoid. An endoscopic evaluation of the sinuses was performed by [organization], with no evidence of invasive fungal infection. remained on intravenous antibiotic therapy until 08/20, when antibiotic therapy was discussed with [organization], and it was decided to transition to oral clavulin ciprofloxacin. In addition to this, he underwent chemotherapy to date without other complications. He required a transfusion of 1 red blood cell concentrate on 08/19, without complications. Normal physical examination upon discharge. No procedures were performed. Diagnosis already established. 1. I provide folinic acid 15 mg 1 tablet, to be taken on 09/01/20 to be taken 24 h after intrathecal chemotherapy 2. I prescribe amoxicillin clavulanate 875 125 mg and ciprofloxacin 500 mg, to be used every 12/12 h, until 8 am on 08/31 3. I prescribe filgrastim for use of 600 mg 2 ampoules in the morning and 300 mg 1 ampoule at night, via subcutaneous application, every day, until the follow-up appointment on 08/27 4. I prescribe prophylaxis: acyclovir 200 mg 2 tablets every 12/12 h sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim 400 80 mg 1 tablet every 12/12 h on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays omeprazole 20 mg 1 capsule on an empty stomach 5. I prescribe, for use in case of constipation and no bowel movement: lactulose syrup 15 ml every 8 hours, and bisacodyl 5 mg 1 tablet at night. 6. I prescribe ondansetron, in case of nausea or vomiting. 08/25 blood center transfusion room 08/27 outside hematology daytime room 10 counter 6 HC 08/31 madit outside hematology daytime room 10 counter 6 HC 09/15 [organization] safety follow-up appointment for clinical reevaluation and check PETCT scheduling counter 6 HC. Good.

question: ১৫ ছেপ্টেম্বৰত মোৰ এপোইন্টমেন্টৰ উদ্দেশ্য কি?

discharge_summary: admission: 10/06/2020, discharge: 11/20/2020, stay: 01 m 13 d 19 h, location: ward, payer: sus. discharge report patient [person], 54 years old, single, from [address], receives retirement benefit, admitted to the emergency unit of [organization] on 10/06 with dyspnea 8 days after admission, fever not measured and cough with greenish sputum. on 10/08, he presented respiratory failure, requiring orotracheal intubation and high oxygen concentrations pao2/fio2 ratio: 104, with neuromuscular blockade for ventilation for sara. On 10/9, due to oliguria in the last 24 hours, however, maintaining a positive fluid balance, he was transferred to the semi-intensive care unit without the use of vasoactive drugs due to the hypothesis of nephrotoxicity. On 10/10, vasoactive drugs were restarted due to poor peripheral perfusion. Neuromuscular blockade with cisatracurium was suspended. [person] developed abdominal distension, with suspension of the diet. On 10/14, an abdominal ultrasound was performed with no signs of ascites or gaseous distension. On 10/15, sedation was suspended. On the same day, [person] presented with a deviation of the fixed gaze to the right, being evaluated by neurology and, after a computed tomography scan of the skull and electroencephalogram, without new alterations that would justify the condition, vitamin B1 replacement was indicated. On 10/19, a thoracic ultrasound was performed, showing evidence of pleural effusion on the left, measuring approximately 3.3 cm. Diagnostic thoracentesis was performed, with negative transudate culture and bacilloscopy, but with positive TBTRM on 10/22. At the time, a case of ICC was discussed, and as [person] did not present a picture suggestive of pulmonary tuberculosis upon admission, with no characteristic image, remaining afebrile throughout hospitalization, with progressive improvement of the pulmonary condition with Bactrim, in addition to 3 negative gastric lavage bacilloscopy samples in August of that year, it was decided not to isolate [person] and not to collect bacilloscopy again, since the diagnosis of pulmonary tuberculosis was very unlikely. On 10/22, extubation was performed, without complications. On 10/23, [person] presented diarrhea, with liquid stools, no pathological products and no other systemic symptoms. On 10/25, he started a soft oral diet with good acceptance, and the nasogastric tube was removed and treatment for pleural tuberculosis was initiated by the attending medical team. On 10/26, [person] was admitted to a bed in the [organization] ward and, on 10/29, transferred to a bed in the [organization] ward, under the care of the infectious disease team. On 10/28, treatment for pneumocystosis with Bactrim D21/D21 was suspended and corticosteroid therapy was suspended, with Bactrim being resumed at a prophylactic dose for neurotoxoplasmosis and pneumocystosis. During hospitalization, [person] presented persistent thrombocytopenia while on prophylactic anticoagulation. Hematology assessed him and indicated the start of full-dose subcutaneous fondaparinoux 7.5 mg. On 11/3, with a platelet count above 150,000, dual anticoagulation with warfarin 5 mg/day was initiated. maintained until 11/08, with warfarin adjustment according to prothrombin time, due to anticoagulation for 4 weeks. In addition, [person] presented anemia probably secondary to azathioprine myelotoxicity and vitamin B12 deficiency. Vitamin B12 replacement was started, 1 vial of 5000 mcg 1x per week. Upon admission to the [organization] ward, it was decided to suspend the RIP regimen due to an acute clinical laboratory picture not compatible with pulmonary or pleural tuberculosis. [person] presented infectious urinalysis culture positive for Klebsiella pneumoniae carbapenemase, but as he remained asymptomatic and with good renal function, it was decided not to treat it, considering contamination. [person] is currently fit for hospital discharge, being on room air, with no signs of discomfort, hemodynamically stable, not using vasoactive drugs, and with good acceptance of oral diet, assisted only by the risk of bronchoaspiration, with international normalized ratio in the range of 2.9 with 5 mg of warfarin/day. Current problem 1. Nosocomial pneumonia? Recent admission to [organization] 08/14 09/25 Community-acquired pneumonia treated with clavulin, pcp Presumed hepatotoxicity due to bactrin Nosocomial pneumonia treated with cefepime 2. Pneumocystosis? 3. Normochromic macrocytic anemia to be clarified secondary to bactrim? Secondary to zidovudine? 4. Thrombocytopenia to be clarified Thrombocytopenia induced by prophylactic heparin? Tests 1. Transthoracic echocardiography 08/17: cardiac chambers with normal dimensions. left ventricular systolic performance and segmental mobility were normal. 2. abdominal ultrasound 8/17: ultrasound signs that may correspond to liver disease, with no evidence of suspicious focal lesions. absence of free intra-abdominal fluid. problem: 1. human immunodeficiency virus c3 diagnosed in 2004 8/17: cd4 135/cv: undetectable 2. neurotoxoplasmosis with motor sequelae in the right upper limb 3. anti hcv / hcv pcr negative 4. neurological disorder to be clarified wernicke's encephalopathy? psychiatric disorder to be clarified 5. chronic liver disease diagnosed in 2016 6. presumed chronic obstructive pulmonary disease medications in use risperidone 2 mg at night warfarin 5 mg/day until 12/01 discontinue after antiretroviral therapy: tenofovir 300 mg lamivudine 300 mg 1 tablet early darunavir 600 mg 1 tablet 12/12h ritonavir 100 mg 1 tablet 12/12h sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim 400 80 mg 1 tablet 12/12h pcp prophylaxis and neurotoxicity folinic acid 15 mg 1 tablet/day. no changes.. programming we consider anemia secondary to probable myelotoxicity due to antiretroviral therapy AZT being replaced by tenofovir on 11/09. I maintain prophylaxis for PCP and neurotox with Bactrim, maintain folinic acid replacement 15 mg/day until follow-up appointment, decided to suspend vitamin B12 replacement, given 2 recent dosages with normal vitamin B12, maintain anticoagulation with warfarin started on 11/03 for 4 weeks until 12/01. follow-up appointment to the outpatient clinic, request tests for follow-up appointment. Good.
question: মই ইমান দিন চিকিৎসালয়ত কিয় আছিলোঁ?
answer: আপোনাক ১০/০৬ তাৰিখে শ্বাসকষ্ট আৰু কাহৰ সৈতে জৰুৰীকালীন বিভাগত ভৰ্তি কৰোৱা হৈছিল। ১০/০৮ তাৰিখে আপোনাৰ শ্বাস-প্ৰশ্বাস বিকল হৈছিল আৰু তেতিয়া আপোনাক অৰোট্ৰেকিয়েল ইন্টুবেচন (শ্বাস-প্ৰশ্বাসৰ নলিকা)ৰ প্ৰয়োজন হৈছিল।

question: ৰি portৰ্টত কৈছে যে যক্ষ্মাৰ বাবে পৰীক্ষা ইতিবাচক আছিল, কিন্তু তাৰ পিছত কৈছে যে মোৰ নাই। মোৰ টিবি আছে নে নাই?
answer: আপোনাৰ হাওঁফাওঁৰ তৰল পদাৰ্থৰ পৰীক্ষাত টিবিটিআৰএম পজিটিভ ওলাইছিল। কিন্তু চিকিৎসা আৰম্ভ কৰি তাৰ পিছত বন্ধ কৰি দিয়া হৈছিল, কাৰণ আপোনাৰ 'ক্লিনিকেল লেবৰেটৰীৰ ছবিখন পালমোনাৰী বা প্লুৰেল যক্ষ্মাৰ সৈতে খাপ খোৱা নাছিল,' আৰু ৰোগ নিৰ্ণয়ক 'অতি কম সম্ভাৱনাপূৰ্ণ' বুলি গণ্য কৰা হৈছিল।

question: মোৰ এইচআইভিৰ ঔষধবোৰৰ এটা কিয় সলনি হ’ল?
answer: এনিমিয়া 'এণ্টিৰেট্ৰোভাইৰেল থেৰাপী এজেডটিৰ ফলত সম্ভাৱ্য মাইল' টক্সিসিটি'ৰ গৌণ বুলি গণ্য কৰা হৈছিল যাক ১১/০৯ তাৰিখে টেনোফ'ভিৰে সলনি কৰিছিল।

discharge_summary: admission: 10/06/2020, discharge: 11/20/2020, stay: 01 m 13 d 19 h, location: ward, payer: sus. discharge report patient [person], 54 years old, single, from [address], receives retirement benefit, admitted to the emergency unit of [organization] on 10/06 with dyspnea 8 days after admission, fever not measured and cough with greenish sputum. on 10/08, he presented respiratory failure, requiring orotracheal intubation and high oxygen concentrations pao2/fio2 ratio: 104, with neuromuscular blockade for ventilation for sara. On 10/9, due to oliguria in the last 24 hours, however, maintaining a positive fluid balance, he was transferred to the semi-intensive care unit without the use of vasoactive drugs due to the hypothesis of nephrotoxicity. On 10/10, vasoactive drugs were restarted due to poor peripheral perfusion. Neuromuscular blockade with cisatracurium was suspended. [person] developed abdominal distension, with suspension of the diet. On 10/14, an abdominal ultrasound was performed with no signs of ascites or gaseous distension. On 10/15, sedation was suspended. On the same day, [person] presented with a deviation of the fixed gaze to the right, being evaluated by neurology and, after a computed tomography scan of the skull and electroencephalogram, without new alterations that would justify the condition, vitamin B1 replacement was indicated. On 10/19, a thoracic ultrasound was performed, showing evidence of pleural effusion on the left, measuring approximately 3.3 cm. Diagnostic thoracentesis was performed, with negative transudate culture and bacilloscopy, but with positive TBTRM on 10/22. At the time, a case of ICC was discussed, and as [person] did not present a picture suggestive of pulmonary tuberculosis upon admission, with no characteristic image, remaining afebrile throughout hospitalization, with progressive improvement of the pulmonary condition with Bactrim, in addition to 3 negative gastric lavage bacilloscopy samples in August of that year, it was decided not to isolate [person] and not to collect bacilloscopy again, since the diagnosis of pulmonary tuberculosis was very unlikely. On 10/22, extubation was performed, without complications. On 10/23, [person] presented diarrhea, with liquid stools, no pathological products and no other systemic symptoms. On 10/25, he started a soft oral diet with good acceptance, and the nasogastric tube was removed and treatment for pleural tuberculosis was initiated by the attending medical team. On 10/26, [person] was admitted to a bed in the [organization] ward and, on 10/29, transferred to a bed in the [organization] ward, under the care of the infectious disease team. On 10/28, treatment for pneumocystosis with Bactrim D21/D21 was suspended and corticosteroid therapy was suspended, with Bactrim being resumed at a prophylactic dose for neurotoxoplasmosis and pneumocystosis. During hospitalization, [person] presented persistent thrombocytopenia while on prophylactic anticoagulation. Hematology assessed him and indicated the start of full-dose subcutaneous fondaparinoux 7.5 mg. On 11/3, with a platelet count above 150,000, dual anticoagulation with warfarin 5 mg/day was initiated. maintained until 11/08, with warfarin adjustment according to prothrombin time, due to anticoagulation for 4 weeks. In addition, [person] presented anemia probably secondary to azathioprine myelotoxicity and vitamin B12 deficiency. Vitamin B12 replacement was started, 1 vial of 5000 mcg 1x per week. Upon admission to the [organization] ward, it was decided to suspend the RIP regimen due to an acute clinical laboratory picture not compatible with pulmonary or pleural tuberculosis. [person] presented infectious urinalysis culture positive for Klebsiella pneumoniae carbapenemase, but as he remained asymptomatic and with good renal function, it was decided not to treat it, considering contamination. [person] is currently fit for hospital discharge, being on room air, with no signs of discomfort, hemodynamically stable, not using vasoactive drugs, and with good acceptance of oral diet, assisted only by the risk of bronchoaspiration, with international normalized ratio in the range of 2.9 with 5 mg of warfarin/day. Current problem 1. Nosocomial pneumonia? Recent admission to [organization] 08/14 09/25 Community-acquired pneumonia treated with clavulin, pcp Presumed hepatotoxicity due to bactrin Nosocomial pneumonia treated with cefepime 2. Pneumocystosis? 3. Normochromic macrocytic anemia to be clarified secondary to bactrim? Secondary to zidovudine? 4. Thrombocytopenia to be clarified Thrombocytopenia induced by prophylactic heparin? Tests 1. Transthoracic echocardiography 08/17: cardiac chambers with normal dimensions. left ventricular systolic performance and segmental mobility were normal. 2. abdominal ultrasound 8/17: ultrasound signs that may correspond to liver disease, with no evidence of suspicious focal lesions. absence of free intra-abdominal fluid. problem: 1. human immunodeficiency virus c3 diagnosed in 2004 8/17: cd4 135/cv: undetectable 2. neurotoxoplasmosis with motor sequelae in the right upper limb 3. anti hcv / hcv pcr negative 4. neurological disorder to be clarified wernicke's encephalopathy? psychiatric disorder to be clarified 5. chronic liver disease diagnosed in 2016 6. presumed chronic obstructive pulmonary disease medications in use risperidone 2 mg at night warfarin 5 mg/day until 12/01 discontinue after antiretroviral therapy: tenofovir 300 mg lamivudine 300 mg 1 tablet early darunavir 600 mg 1 tablet 12/12h ritonavir 100 mg 1 tablet 12/12h sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim 400 80 mg 1 tablet 12/12h pcp prophylaxis and neurotoxicity folinic acid 15 mg 1 tablet/day. no changes.. programming we consider anemia secondary to probable myelotoxicity due to antiretroviral therapy AZT being replaced by tenofovir on 11/09. I maintain prophylaxis for PCP and neurotox with Bactrim, maintain folinic acid replacement 15 mg/day until follow-up appointment, decided to suspend vitamin B12 replacement, given 2 recent dosages with normal vitamin B12, maintain anticoagulation with warfarin started on 11/03 for 4 weeks until 12/01. follow-up appointment to the outpatient clinic, request tests for follow-up appointment. Good.
question: মই কিয় ৱাৰফেৰিন, তেজ পাতল কৰা ঔষধটো খাই আছোঁ?
answer: আপোনাৰ চিকিৎসালয়ত থকাৰ সময়ত, আপোনাৰ 'দীৰ্ঘস্থায়ী থ্ৰম্বোচাইটোপেনিয়া' (কম প্লেটলেট) হৈছিল। ৰক্তবিজ্ঞান বিভাগৰ পৰামৰ্শ লোৱা হৈছিল আৰু অৱশেষত আপোনাক ৱাৰফেৰিন আৰম্ভ কৰা হৈছিল। পৰিকল্পনাটো হ'ল '১১/০৩ তাৰিখে আৰম্ভ কৰা ৱাৰফেৰিনৰ সৈতে ৪ সপ্তাহলৈ ১২/০১ তাৰিখলৈকে ৰক্ত জমাট বন্ধ কৰা কাৰ্য্য অব্যাহত ৰখা'।

question: মোৰ চকুকেইটা সোঁফালে চাই থকা অৱস্থাত কি হৈছিল?
answer: ১৫ অক্টোবৰত, আপুনি 'সোঁফালে স্থিৰ দৃষ্টিৰ বিচ্যুতি'ৰ সৈতে উপস্থিত হৈছিল। আপোনাক নিউৰোলজিৰ দ্বাৰা মূল্যায়ন কৰা হৈছিল, আৰু মূৰৰ খুলিৰ চিটি স্কেন আৰু ইলেক্ট্ৰোএনচেফালোগ্ৰামৰ পিছত, 'অৱস্থাটো ন্যায্যতা প্ৰদান কৰিব পৰা কোনো নতুন পৰিৱৰ্তন নাছিল,' আৰু ভিটামিন বি১ পুনৰুদ্ধাৰৰ ইংগিত দিয়া হৈছিল।

question: মোৰ প্ৰস্ৰাৱ পৰীক্ষাত এটা বেক্টেৰিয়া পোৱা গৈছে। মই ইয়াৰ বাবে কিয় চিকিৎসা লোৱা নাই?
answer: আপোনাৰ ইউৰিন কালচাৰত Klebsiella pneumoniae carbapenemase পজিটিভ ওলাইছিল, কিন্তু আপোনাৰ কোনো লক্ষণ নাছিল আৰু বৃক্কৰ কাৰ্যক্ষমতা ভাল আছিল। এই কাৰণে ইয়াক চিকিৎসা নকৰাৰ সিদ্ধান্ত লোৱা হৈছিল, কিয়নো ইয়াক দূষিত বুলি গণ্য কৰা হৈছিল।

question: সংক্ৰমণটো নাই নেকি?
answer: আপুনি জ্বৰমুক্ত হৈ আছিল আৰু ২৮/১১ তাৰিখৰ পৰা ক্ৰমান্বয়ে তেজৰ কালচাৰ নিগেটিভ হৈছিল। লগতে, ঘাঁবোৰত তুলনামূলক ৰেডিঅ'লজিকেল উন্নতি দেখা গৈছিল।

question: মোৰ ডায়ালাইছিছ ফিষ্টুলাত কি সমস্যা হৈছে?
answer: আপোনাৰ বাওঁ হাতৰ ওপৰৰ অংশত থকা ধমনী আৰু সিৰাৰ ফিস্টুলাত স্থানীয় ষ্টেনোচিছ দেখা গৈছিল। ষ্টেনোচিছৰ স্থান নিৰ্ণয় কৰিবলৈ এটা মূল্যায়নৰ প্ৰয়োজন।

question: মোৰ কি কি ফলো-আপ এপোইণ্টমেণ্ট আছে?
answer: আপোনাৰ ১৩/০১ তাৰিখে হৃদৰোগ বিশেষজ্ঞৰ সৈতে সাক্ষাৎ আৰু ১৬/০১/২০২১ তাৰিখে আপোনাৰ প্ৰেচাৰ ইনজুৰীৰ বাবে ফলো-আপ আছে। আপুনি মটৰ ৰিহেবিলিটেচনৰ বাবেও এটা এপোইন্টমেন্টৰ বাবে অপেক্ষা কৰি আছে।

question: মোৰ কেথেটাৰটোৰ কি হ’ল?

question: যোৱাৰ পিছত মই কিয় ৰিভাৰক্সাবান (তেজ পাতল কৰা ঔষধ) ল'ব লাগিব?
answer: আপোনাক 'পালমোনাৰী থ্ৰম্বোএম্বোলিজম' (তেজৰ গোট মৰা)ৰ বাবে '৬ মাহৰ বাবে এন্টিকোৱাগুলেচন'ৰ প্ৰয়োজন। আপুনি 'ৰিভাৰক্সাবান ১৫ মিগ্ৰা ১২/১২ ঘণ্টা আন ৭ দিনৰ বাবে' আৰু তাৰ পিছত '২০ মিগ্ৰা/দিন' ব্যৱহাৰ কৰিব লাগিব।

discharge_summary: coronavirus . admission: 2020-03-15, discharge: 2020-05-11, stay: 01 m 25 d 17 h, location: ward, payer: sus. id: [person], 59 years old, from [address] patient admitted on 2020-03-15 to the emergency unit of [organization] due to severe acute respiratory syndrome caused by coronavirus. patient in need of orotracheal intubation since 2020-03-17 with progression to tracheostomy on 2020-04-08. evolved with improvement in respiratory parameters being decannulated on 2020-05-08, remaining without tracheostomy, without respiratory discomfort, only with occlusive dressing. presented several complications during hospitalization, such as: 1 low-embolic load pulmonary thromboembolism, examination described below; 2 pulmonary septic shock with carbapenem-sensitive Acinetobacter baumannii, being treated with meropnem and polymyxin for 10 days and subsequently using tigecycline for 14 days, with improvement in the condition; 3 acute kidney injury, code 3, without the need for dialysis with subsequent reversal; 4 primary bloodstream infection secondary to Burkholderia cepacia, sensitive to ceftazidime and Bactrim. evolved with rehabilitation with motor and respiratory physiotherapy, with good tolerance and improved functionality during hospitalization. [person] without the need for oxygen therapy for more than 48 hours, with the need to consolidate treatment for bloodstream infection with oral Bactrim. opted for hospital discharge after a long period of hospitalization with improvement in the coronavirus condition and hospital complications. described below is the schedule for ending treatment for [person] after discharge. good general condition, pale 2/4, hydrated, oriented in time and space, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile, eupneic heart rate: 70 oxygen saturation: 98% in room air cardiac auscultation: heart rhythm in normal S1 and S2, no murmurs, normal heart sounds, preserved capillary refill time, absence of jugular distension at 90º respiratory auscultation: vesicular breath sounds present, no adventitious sounds, absence of use of accessory respiratory muscles abdomen: flaccid, painless, bowel sounds present and normal, tympanic to percussion, no palpable masses or palpable visceromegaly extremities: palpable peripheral pulses, well perfused extremities, absence of edema in the lower limbs, absence of signs of deep vein thrombosis neurology: Glasgow Coma Scale 15, presence of tremor postural in upper limbs. coronavirus pulmonary thromboembolism. schedule: anticoagulation for 6 months counting the start of treatment from 03/31/2020 ending on 09/31/2020 at the moment there is a need to use rivaroxaban 15 mg 12/12 h for another 7 days after discharge and subsequently use of a dose of rivaroxaban 20 mg/day until 05/07/2020. end of treatment for bloodstream infection with bactrin 2 tablets 8/8 hours for another 5 days after hospital discharge requested maintenance of respiratory and motor physiotherapy in [person's] city of origin. hospitalization exams: chest CT Angiography (CTA) 03/31: acute pulmonary thromboembolism with low embolic burden, without cor pulmonale. opacities compatible with coronavirus, severe involvement 50 - 75% with a component of organizing pneumonia and fibroreaction. cardiomegaly. Transthoracic echocardiography 07/05: ejection fraction 57%, mild dilation of the left atrium, preserved systolic performance of the right and left ventricles, without images suggestive of vegetation. discharge with follow-up in primary care. good conditions for hospital discharge.
question: মই এতিয়াও বেক্ট্ৰিম (এটা এন্টিবায়'টিক) কিয় খাই আছোঁ?

discharge_summary: admission: 05/28/2020, discharge: 06/06/2020, stay: 09 d 04 h, location: ward, payer: sus. identification: [person], 80 years old, from [address], social worker, retired, married. problem: 1 sepsis of pulmonary focus treated with ceftriaxone d10 clarithromycin d8 pulmonary focus: productive cough flu-like symptoms fever dyspnea desaturation 6 days ago acute kidney injury kdigo 3 creat 2.14 / basal 0.68 discharged from nephrology on 06/05. hypotension requiring norepinephrine. 2 atrial fibrillation with high ventricular response 05/28 reversed amiodarone chads2vas 4. 3 urinary tract infection candida treated with fluconazole. History of current illness: Patient with previous chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, under treatment with anoro umeclidino vilanterol, with a history of smoking, discontinued in 1988 53 pack-years. Reports that 6 days ago he started having a productive cough, associated with runny nose, nasal obstruction and shortness of breath, as well as a fever of 38 ºC in the first 3 days of symptoms. 3 days ago, he had an appointment with a pulmonologist, and was started on oseltamivir every 12 hours, but for the past 1 day he has been developing worsening shortness of breath, ventilatory-dependent pain in the back and lung bases, as well as a decline in general condition. Reports having taken tests for coronavirus and influenza, both negative. Denies gastrointestinal and genitourinary complaints. No other complaints. Personal history: 1. Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (IPD)? Aspiration?? Spirometry 2019: obstruction with FEV1 31.59%, FVC 63.9%, no response to bronchodilator. Chest computed tomography 2021: emphysema, reticular infiltrate without honeycombing in the right base. Aspiration? 2. Systemic arterial hypertension 3. Diabetes mellitus 4. Hypothyroidism 5. Depressive disorder under current treatment. 6. Hearing impairment under treatment with a hearing aid. Continuous-use medications: Anoro, Metformin 1000 mg/day, Dapagliflozin 10 mg, Escitalopram 10 mg, Puran T 125 mcg, Rosuvastatin 5 mg, Calcium carbonate 1000 mg/day, Vit D3 1000 IU/day. Allergies: Denies. Surgeries: Denies. habits and addictions: denies alcoholism, smoking 52 pack-years; quit in 1988. antibiotic therapy ceftriaxone 1g 12/12h 05/28 06/06 clarithromycin 500 mg 12/12h 05/28 05/06 fluconazole 05/31 06/06. tests: transthoracic echocardiography 05/30/2020: mild left atrial dilation. concentric left ventricular remodeling, preserved systolic performance of the ventricles. normal left ventricular segmental mobility. mild mac mitral annular calcification. mild mitral and ai. clinical evolution [organization] finds [person] in a ward bed accompanied by [person]. hemodynamically stable, using a central venous catheter, no vasoactive drugs, and an indwelling urinary catheter. [person] reports improvement in respiratory condition, with reduction in fatigue and inspiratory pain and improvement in cough in appearance and volume, but reports that dyspnea persists with minimal effort such as taking a bath. Reports regular use of alenia, without use of supplemental oxygen, eupneic in room air, presents improvement in respiratory pattern. Reports anal pain, with presence of prolapsed hemorrhoid. Reports daily bowel movements, of liquid pasty consistency, without pain or effort. Reports bedsore in gluteal region without pain symptoms, reported by nursing and {person}. Discussed during visit with [person]: [person] with pneumococcus intermediate to ceftriaxone, however, given clinical and laboratory improvement, weaning from oxygen, maintaining cough, improving, we recommend hospital discharge. I keep [person] aware that in the event of further clinical worsening, he should seek emergency unit for reevaluation. [person] did not present recurrence of atrial fibrillation with high ventricular response; however, due to CHADs2 of 4, with a high risk of recurrence, seen in transthoracic echocardiography with atrial enlargement, we maintained rhythm control with amiodarone 200 mg 12/12h and started anticoagulation with rivaroxaban 20 mg/day. In addition, during hospitalization, he presented worsening of hemorrhoidal disease, now prolapsed, on local conservative therapy. Upon discharge, we requested a control electrocardiogram, laboratory tests for follow-up, scheduled to be performed on 06/27 with teleconsultation on 06/28. prescription at discharge: amiodarone 200 mg 12/12h rivaroxaban 20 mg/day amlodipine 5 mg 12/12h levothyroxine 125 mcg/day rosuvastatin 5 mg/day escitalopram 10 mg/day metformin xr 1g/day dapagliflozin 10 mg/day anoro 1 spray per day salbutamol sn proctyl ointment. follow-up: teleconsultation with geriatrics on 06/28 in the afternoon. good general condition, conscious, oriented, eupneic in room air, no pain complaints, with clinical improvement and recovery of renal function.

There was no clinical or electrographic reactivity to nociceptive stimulation. b Record of electrographic seizures of variable duration (4 to 9 seconds), characterized by rhythmic activity in the beta range, evolving to alpha and theta ranges, associated with spike-type epileptiform paroxysms, with generalized projection, without associated clinical phenomena. There was a record of a seizure with rhythmic evolution to the delta range and of longer duration (18 seconds). Rare spike-type paroxysms were recorded, occurring isolatedly in the left frontocentral region. Clinical correlation: The findings are consistent with focal epilepsy with electrographic seizures, but do not characterize status epilepticus. electroencephalogram 12/19: marked symmetrical disorganization of the background activity due to persistent rhythmic, semi-rhythmic bifrontal slowing in the delta band, at approximately 1.5 Hz, of medium amplitude, only temporarily mitigated by nociceptive stimulation; furthermore, lack and poor definition of physiological graphoelements of sleep. Upon nociceptive stimulation, there is also a triggering of generalized rhythmic epileptiform activity in the beta band, of low voltage, which evolves into an outbreak of frank epileptiform paroxysms of the spike type followed by a slow wave, also of diffuse expression, and with bifrontal accentuation of such stimulus-induced discharges, suppression of the clinical tracing follows; [person] presents only with painful facies. b Occasionally, associated with the slow waves described above, bisynchronous epileptiform paroxysms of the sharp wave type are observed, involving the anterior regions of the scalp. Conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. The findings are compatible with severe diffuse encephalopathy of a nonspecific nature, associated with focal and generalized interictal epileptogenesis, the latter being stimulus-induced. Electroencephalogram 12/22: a moderate symmetrical disorganization of the background activity due to an increase in the content of slow waves in the theta and delta bands, in addition to a lack and poor definition of the physiological graphoelements of sleep. However, good electroencephalographic reactivity is noted in response to nociceptive stimuli, with an association with a dominant posterior rhythmic outline in the alpha band. b bursts of generalized rhythmic delta activity (grda) with bifrontal accentuation, occurring intermittently throughout the tracing during sleep, consisting of stereotyped waves in the 2.0 to 2.5 Hz band. Conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. The findings are compatible with moderate diffuse encephalopathy, of a nonspecific nature in relation to the previous tracing; significant improvement is noted, with mitigation of grda and suppression of stimulus-induced generalized epileptogenesis. electroencephalogram 02/01: slight symmetrical disorganization of the baseline activity due to the slowing of the dominant posterior rhythm of wakefulness, recorded at a frequency of up to 6.5 Hz, however with the presence of typical physiological graphoelements of sleep. b recording of epileptiform paroxysms of the spike and sharp wave type, with generalized projection, with anterior accentuation, occurring in rhythmic bursts of short duration of 3 to 4 seconds. the paroxysms are followed by delta waves and, occasionally, rhythmic activity in the beta range of short duration of less than 1 second, which also occurred preceding the bursts of paroxysms, as well as in an isolated episode during drowsiness. c outbreaks of generalized delta activity, with bifrontal accentuation, the same projections as the paroxysms, also occurring exclusively during sleep. note: [person] presented stereotyped cephalic lateralization and oromandibular movements during wakefulness, however, without electrographic correlation with ictal patterns. conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. the findings are compatible with diffuse encephalopathy and generalized epilepsy. computed tomography of the skull 11/12: no relevant alterations; AEDC follow-up appointments: 02/02 schedule to complete antibiotic therapy directed at pseudomonas bloodstream infection: using ceftazidime d3, maintain for 7-10 days: currently clinically stable, cpr falling, last 2.5 AEDC: 02/02/22 maintain current antiepileptic drugs until follow-up appointment: phenytoin 100 mg 12/12h phenobarbital 100 mg 12/12h topiramate 100 100 200 clobazam 20 mg 8/8h lamotrigine 100 100 200 I renew prescriptions from [organization] regarding deep vein thrombosis: I prescribe rivaroxaban 20 mg/d, I provide a prescription for 6 months. I request follow-up in the network. Follow-up by physiotherapy at the CER: difficulty walking, associated with equine feet. Wheelchair, bath and diaper report: already delivered. Globular abdomen, bowel sounds, depressed and no signs of defense. Warm extremities, capillary refill time less than 3s, free calves Glasgow 14, isochoric and photoreactive pupils, no pupillary hippus, no stigmata of crisis. question: মই ইমানবোৰ বেলেগ বেলেগ ছিজাৰৰ ঔষধ কিয় খাই আছোঁ?
answer: পৰিকল্পনাটো হ'ল 'অনুৱৰ্তী নিযুক্তি নোহোৱালৈকে বৰ্তমানৰ মৃগী ৰোগৰ ঔষধসমূহ বজাই ৰখা'। তালিকাত ফেনেটইন, ফেনোবাৰ্বিচেল, টপিৰামেট, ক্ল’বাজাম আৰু লেম’ট্ৰিজিন অন্তৰ্ভুক্ত আছে।

question: মোক কিয় ৬ মাহৰ বাবে ৰিভাৰক্সাবান দিয়া হৈছে?

Tests: Electroencephalogram 12/12: Mild to moderate disorganization of baseline activity due to increased slow wave content in the theta and delta bands, but with the presence of normal sleep graphoelements. There was no clinical or electrographic reactivity to nociceptive stimulation. b Record of electrographic seizures of variable duration (4 to 9 seconds), characterized by rhythmic activity in the beta range, evolving to alpha and theta ranges, associated with spike-type epileptiform paroxysms, with generalized projection, without associated clinical phenomena. There was a record of a seizure with rhythmic evolution to the delta range and of longer duration (18 seconds). Rare spike-type paroxysms were recorded, occurring isolatedly in the left frontocentral region. Clinical correlation: The findings are consistent with focal epilepsy with electrographic seizures, but do not characterize status epilepticus. electroencephalogram 12/19: marked symmetrical disorganization of the background activity due to persistent rhythmic, semi-rhythmic bifrontal slowing in the delta band, at approximately 1.5 Hz, of medium amplitude, only temporarily mitigated by nociceptive stimulation; furthermore, lack and poor definition of physiological graphoelements of sleep. Upon nociceptive stimulation, there is also a triggering of generalized rhythmic epileptiform activity in the beta band, of low voltage, which evolves into an outbreak of frank epileptiform paroxysms of the spike type followed by a slow wave, also of diffuse expression, and with bifrontal accentuation of such stimulus-induced discharges, suppression of the clinical tracing follows; [person] presents only with painful facies. b Occasionally, associated with the slow waves described above, bisynchronous epileptiform paroxysms of the sharp wave type are observed, involving the anterior regions of the scalp. Conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. The findings are compatible with severe diffuse encephalopathy of a nonspecific nature, associated with focal and generalized interictal epileptogenesis, the latter being stimulus-induced. Electroencephalogram 12/22: a moderate symmetrical disorganization of the background activity due to an increase in the content of slow waves in the theta and delta bands, in addition to a lack and poor definition of the physiological graphoelements of sleep. However, good electroencephalographic reactivity is noted in response to nociceBptive stimuli, with an association with a dominant posterior rhythmic outline in the alpha band. b bursts of generalized rhythmic delta activity (grda) with bifrontal accentuation, occurring intermittently throughout the tracing during sleep, consisting of stereotyped waves in the 2.0 to 2.5 Hz band. Conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. The findings are compatible with moderate diffuse encephalopathy, of a nonspecific nature in relation to the previous tracing; significant improvement is noted, with mitigation of grda and suppression of stimulus-induced generalized epileptogenesis. electroencephalogram 02/01: slight symmetrical disorganization of the baseline activity due to the slowing of the dominant posterior rhythm of wakefulness, recorded at a frequency of up to 6.5 Hz, however with the presence of typical physiological graphoelements of sleep. b recording of epileptiform paroxysms of the spike and sharp wave type, with generalized projection, with anterior accentuation, occurring in rhythmic bursts of short duration of 3 to 4 seconds. the paroxysms are followed by delta waves and, occasionally, rhythmic activity in the beta range of short duration of less than 1 second, which also occurred preceding the bursts of paroxysms, as well as in an isolated episode during drowsiness. c outbreaks of generalized delta activity, with bifrontal accentuation, the same projections as the paroxysms, also occurring exclusively during sleep. note: [person] presented stereotyped cephalic lateralization and oromandibular movements during wakefulness, however, without electrographic correlation with ictal patterns. conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. the findings are compatible with diffuse encephalopathy and generalized epilepsy. computed tomography of the skull 11/12: no relevant alterations; AEDC follow-up appointments: 02/02 schedule to complete antibiotic therapy directed at pseudomonas bloodstream infection: using ceftazidime d3, maintain for 7-10 days: currently clinically stable, cpr falling, last 2.5 AEDC: 02/02/22 maintain current antiepileptic drugs until follow-up appointment: phenytoin 100 mg 12/12h phenobarbital 100 mg 12/12h topiramate 100 100 200 clobazam 20 mg 8/8h lamotrigine 100 100 200 I renew prescriptions from [organization] regarding deep vein thrombosis: I prescribe rivaroxaban 20 mg/d, I provide a prescription for 6 months. question: মোৰ মগজুৰ পৰীক্ষাবোৰ (ইইজি) মোৰ থকাৰ সময়ত ভাল হৈছিল নেকি?
answer: হয়, ১৯/১২ তাৰিখে কৰা ইইজি-ত 'গুৰুতৰ ডিফিউজ এনকেফেಲೋপেথী' দেখা গৈছিল, কিন্তু ২২/১২ তাৰিখে কৰা ইইজি-ত 'পূৰ্বৰ ট্ৰেছিঙৰ তুলনাত যথেষ্ট উন্নতি' দেখা গৈছিল।

question: মোৰ চিটি স্কেনত কি দেখা গৈছিল?
answer: 'মূৰৰ খুলিৰ কম্পিউটেড টম’গ্ৰাফী'ত 'কোনো প্ৰাসংগিক পৰিৱৰ্তন দেখা নগ’ল'। 'বুকুৰ কম্পিউটেড টম’গ্ৰাফী'ত 'কোনো সংক্ৰামক প্ৰক্ৰিয়াৰ চিন দেখা নগ’ল'।

question: মই চিকিৎসালয়ৰ পৰা ওলাই অহাৰ সময়ত মোৰ অৱস্থা কেনে আছে?
answer: সাৰাংশত উল্লেখ কৰা হৈছে যে আপুনি 'সাধাৰণ অৱস্থাত', 'জলযুক্ত' আৰু 'জ্বৰমুক্ত' (জ্বৰ নাই)। আপোনাৰ 'গ্লাছগো ১৪', 'চাৰিওটা অংগ ওপৰলৈ তুলিব পাৰে আৰু মাধ্যাকৰ্ষণৰ বিপৰীতে ধৰি ৰাখিব পাৰে', আৰু 'আদেশ বুজি পায় আৰু মানি চলে'।

question: ১৯ অক্টোবৰত কৰা হৃদযন্ত্ৰৰ পৰীক্ষা (ইকোকাৰ্ডিঅ'গ্ৰাম)ত কি পোৱা গৈছিল?
answer: '১৯ অক্টোবৰত কৰা ট্ৰান্সথোৰাচিক ইকোকাৰ্ডিওগ্ৰাফীত' 'মাইট্ৰেল ভাল্ভত সংক্ৰামক উদ্ভিদৰ ইংগিত দিয়া ফিলামেন্টেছ ছবি পোৱা গৈছিল' (সংক্ৰমণৰ ফলত হোৱা বৃদ্ধি), যি 'বেক্টেৰিয়া আৰু ভেঁকুৰৰ এন্ডোকাৰ্ডাইটিছৰ ডায়েগনষ্টিক হাইপোথেছিছ' নিশ্চিত কৰিছিল।

question: অক্টোবৰৰ ৩১ তাৰিখে মোৰ যিটো ৰ‍্যাশ হৈছিল, সেইটোৰ কি হ'ল? সেইটো কিমান গুৰুতৰ আছিল নেকি?
answer: ১০/৩১ তাৰিখে, আপুনি 'ছালত এটা ৰঙা দাগ দেখা গৈছিল'। 'ড্ৰেছ্ চিনড্ৰোমৰ অনুমান উত্থাপন কৰা হৈছিল, কিন্তু [ব্যক্তি]য়ে ৰঙা দাগৰ সম্পূৰ্ণ উন্নতি আৰু ইওচিনোফিলৰ সংখ্যা হ্ৰাস হোৱা দেখুৱালে। সেয়েহে, সেই সময়ত কম ক্লিনিক্যাল সন্দেহ থকাৰ বাবে আমি তেওঁক অব্যাহতি দিবলৈ সিদ্ধান্ত লৈছিলো।'

question: মোৰ মাল্টিপল মাইলোমাৰ অৱস্থা কি? শেষৰ চিটি স্কেনত কি দেখা গৈছিল?
answer: 'বুকুৰ টমোগ্ৰাফী... ১৮ অক্টোবৰত পুনৰাবৃত্তি কৰা হৈছিল' দেখুৱাইছিল যে '০৯/২৯ ৰ তুলনাত ৰোগৰ স্থিৰতাৰ সৈতে বিস্তৃত হাড় আৰু সোঁ প্লুৰেল ৰোগৰ সৈতে মাল্টিপল মাইলোমাৰ নিয়ন্ত্ৰণ আছে'।

discharge_summary: admission: 09/01/2020, discharge: 09/17/2020, stay: 16 d 13 h, location: ward, payer: SUS. A 67-year-old patient with a history of overweight, smoking, and major depression was admitted on 09/01 with a perforative acute abdomen, diagnosed after examinations. On the evening of 08/31, she sought care with abdominal pain, general malaise, and dyspnea. She had undergone hysterectomy on 08/30. On 09/01, she underwent exploratory laparotomy with a finding of intestinal perforation, with a suture of the lesion and placement of a peritoneostomy. She developed severe circulatory shock, probably due to peritonitis from contamination of the abdominal cavity, and antibiotic treatment was promptly started. She was re-addressed on 09/06, where an appendectomy and abdominal wall closure were performed. On 09/07, the patient's ventilatory status began to worsen, and a chest tomography scan was performed on 09/08, revealing low-load pulmonary embolism (5%) in addition to pneumonia. A multiresistant germ was isolated in a lung culture, with specific treatment directed at the patient. Given the clinical progression, a tracheostomy was indicated due to the need for prolonged mechanical ventilation. On 09/15, {omitted} prolonged cardiopulmonary arrest was reversed after approximately 20 minutes. The patient follow-up appointmented to the intensive care unit after the procedure, with mydriatic pupils and absence of reflexes. On 09/17, a computed tomography scan of the skull was performed, revealing anoxic-ischemic encephalopathy. Tests were performed to confirm brain death, which was confirmed on {omitted}. question: মোৰ শ্বাস-প্ৰশ্বাসৰ নলীটোৰ (ট্ৰেকিয়োষ্টমী) কি হ’ল?
answer: আপুনি 'ফাইব্ৰোস্কোপী কৰা হৈছিল' আৰু 'কোনো অৱশিষ্ট শ্বাস-প্ৰশ্বাসৰ আঘাত চিনাক্ত কৰা হোৱা নাই'। 'তেওঁক ০৩/০৩ তাৰিখে ডিকেনুলেট কৰা হৈছিল (টিউব আঁতৰোৱা হৈছিল)'। অব্যাহতিৰ সময়ত, 'ট্ৰেকিয়ষ্টমীৰ বিন্ধাটো ড্ৰেছিংৰে বন্ধ কৰা হৈছিল'।

discharge_summary: 1 severe acute respiratory syndrome, due to coronavirus. 2 new septic shock 01/14, fever hypotension, 3 acneiform eruption secondary to corticosteroid therapy, 4 pneumomediastinum airway injury? subcutaneous emphysema after depronation worsening ventilatory status, 5 new septic shock on 01/24 start of vasoactive drug, leukocytosis, 6 reactive adrenal insufficiency? hyperkalemia hyponatremia shock. admission: 01/06/2020, discharge: 03/03/2020, stay: 01 m 24 d 18 h, location: ward, payer: sus. clinical history [person] reports that he started with headache, myalgia and dry cough on 12/28, persisting with the same until 12/31, when he sought care and was prescribed prednisone, azithromycin, zinc and symptomatics. [person] started taking prescribed medications and on 02/01 he started with a fever, having performed a PCR for coronavirus with no result yet. On 03/01 he presented respiratory discomfort, having sought care on 04/01, when antibiotic therapy was changed to intravenous; the family member does not know which medication, however, there was no indication for hospital admission. [person] persisted with respiratory discomfort, having been hospitalized in the early hours of the same day. Emergency care unit report of oxygen saturation of 88% on room air, progressively worsening. He was admitted to the emergency unit on 06/01 with severe pulmonary involvement on chest x-ray, and was continued on antibiotic therapy initiated in the emergency care unit, ceftriaxone daily on 05/01 and prophylactic dexamethasone and enoxaparin initiated. He was admitted to [organization] on 07/01, requiring orotracheal intubation and central venous catheterization. He presented septic shock on 14/01, and his antibiotic regimen was changed. He remained in bed at [organization]. He developed new septic shock on 24/01, and began using fluconazole for fungal coverage. He developed pneumomediastinum on 26/01 due to airway injury, and underwent conservative treatment. He underwent tracheostomy on 29/01. He presented reactive adrenal insufficiency and acneiform rash related to corticosteroid therapy, in addition to diarrhea treated empirically with the hypothesis of pseudomembranous colitis. Acinetobacter baumanii was isolated in the tracheal aspirate, but was not treated due to the lack of clinical repercussion. He presented progressive clinical improvement and was transferred to [organization], where he remained stable. He underwent fibroscopy and was evaluated by speech therapy on 02/03, with no residual airway injury identified and a soft diet was released. He was decannulated on 03/03, remaining eupneic and in condition to be discharged. Good general condition, alert, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile, Glasgow 15, oxygen saturation 94% in room air with capped tracheostomy, respiratory rate 28 inspirations per minute, muscle strength grade 4 in upper and lower limbs, regular heart rhythm in two beats, normal sound sounds without murmurs. Heart rate 76, vesicular breath sounds present, symmetrical, without adventitious sounds, without use of accessory muscles. Flaccid, flat abdomen, painless to palpation, without masses or visceromegaly. Extremities: palpable peripheral pulses, without edema, absence of swelling of the calves. Presence of pressure ulcer in the left lower limb, without signs of infection. Tracheostomy fibroscopy. I advise [person] on outpatient follow-up visits for: head and neck surgery on 03/15 speech therapy on 03/25 reassessment of diet physiatry to be scheduled I advise [person] on home care for tracheostomy orifice, diet, exercise and care. I prescribe symptomatic medications. Aminc, head and neck surgery, speech therapy, physiatry. Good general condition, slim, conscious and oriented, moving all 4 limbs actively with grade 4 muscle strength, still not able to walk alone. Tracheostomy orifice occluded with dressing and eating a soft diet. No pain complaints.
question: মই স্বাভাৱিকভাৱে খাব পাৰিমনে?
answer: আপোনাক '০২/০৩ তাৰিখে স্পীচ থেৰাপীৰ দ্বাৰা মূল্যায়ন কৰা হৈছিল' আৰু 'এক কোমল খাদ্য মুকলি কৰি দিয়া হৈছিল'। অব্যাহতিৰ সময়ত, আপুনি 'এক কোমল খাদ্য খাই আছে'।

question: মই এতিয়া যোৱাৰ সময়ত মোৰ অৱস্থা কেনে আছে?
answer: আপুনি 'ভাল সাধাৰণ অৱস্থাত আছে, সজাগ... জ্বৰ নাই, গ্লাছগো ১৫, কোঠাৰ বতাহত অক্সিজেনৰ মাত্ৰা ৯৪%'। আপুনি 'চাৰিওটা অংগই ৪ গ্ৰেডৰ মাংসপেশীৰ শক্তিৰে সক্ৰিয়ভাৱে লৰচৰ কৰি আছে, তথাপিও অকলে খোজ কাঢ়িব পৰা নাই'।

question: মোৰ কি কি ফলো-আপ এপোইণ্টমেণ্টৰ প্ৰয়োজন?
answer: আপোনাৰ 'বাহিৰৰ ৰোগী হিচাপে পৰ্যালোচনাৰ বাবে ভ্ৰমণৰ প্ৰয়োজন হ'ব: মূৰ আৰু ডিঙিৰ অস্ত্ৰোপচাৰৰ বাবে 03/15 তাৰিখে আৰু স্পীচ থেৰাপীৰ বাবে 03/25 তাৰিখে... ফিজিয়াট্ৰীৰ বাবে সময় নিৰ্ধাৰণ কৰিব লাগিব'।

discharge_summary: 1. pneumonia, pulmonary metastasis? negative external rt pcr on 06/21 verified by surveillance on 06/23 2. syncope to be clarified neurocardiogenic? investigation suspended 3. consumptive syndrome due to duodenal papilla neoplasia. admission: 06/23/2020, discharge: 06/30/2020, stay: 07 d 05 h, location: ward, payer: sus. history of current illness admission: [person] referred from the emergency care unit, where he was hospitalized for 4 days. reports that 3 days ago he had a sudden episode of loss of consciousness, not preceded by prodromes, with follow-up appointment after a few seconds. level of consciousness without dysfunctions afterwards, without release of sphincters. reports only significant asthenia and fatigue associated. had 2 of these episodes on this day. had already had another similar syncope 20 days ago. He had several episodes of vomiting, which started 5 days ago and improved 2 days ago. His family called [organization] due to his condition. During the evaluation by the transport team, [person] reported an episode of fever (38.3 °C) and dry cough since 06/10. During hospitalization at [organization], he was given antibiotic therapy and referred [person] to our services. His syncope did not recur. He reported diarrhea for 15 days and improvement for 3 days, which is why his chemotherapy cycle was suspended. Upon admission, [person] was hemodynamically stable, breathing with a mask with a reservoir at 10 L/min, without respiratory distress, and denying any complaints at the moment. He is afebrile. Edema of the lower limbs, crackles, and reduced vesicular breath sounds on the left. [person] was pale and emaciated. No relevant results. Pleural fluid puncture and chest drain. Pneumonia, no pending tests. Antibiotic therapy: cefepime and clarithromycin. [person] evolves into death.
question: মোক কিয় চিকিৎসালয়ত ভৰ্তি কৰোৱা হৈছিল?
answer: আপোনাক 'জৰুৰীকালীন যত্ন গোটৰ পৰা ৰেফাৰ কৰা হৈছিল'। আপোনাৰ ৩ দিন আগতে 'হঠাৎ অচেতন হোৱাৰ ঘটনা ঘটিছিল' (মূৰ্চ্ছা যোৱা), আৰু 'উল্লেখযোগ্য দুৰ্বলতা আৰু ভাগৰুৱা অনুভৱ হৈছিল'। আপোনাৰ 'জ্বৰ (৩৮.৩ ডিগ্ৰী চেলচিয়াছ) আৰু শুকান কাহো হৈছিল'।

question: মোক কি কি সংক্ৰমণৰ বাবে চিকিৎসা কৰা হৈছিল?
answer: আপোনাক এচেৰেকিয়া কলাইৰ দ্বাৰা হোৱা মূত্ৰনলীৰ সংক্ৰমণৰ বাবে চেফ্ট্ৰিয়াক্সন নামৰ এন্টিবায়টিক ঔষধৰে চিকিৎসা কৰা হৈছিল। আপোনাক চিকিৎসালয়ত হোৱা নিউমোনিয়াৰ বাবে মেৰোপেনেম নামৰ এন্টিবায়টিক ঔষধোৰে চিকিৎসা কৰা হৈছিল।

answer: আপোনাৰ ইলেক্ট্ৰ'এনচেফালোগ্ৰাম (EEG) পৰীক্ষাবোৰ অস্বাভাৱিক আছিল। ফলাফলবোৰক 'মধ্যমীয়াৰ পৰা অতি বেছি বিক্ষিপ্ত বিশৃংখলতা' বুলি বৰ্ণনা কৰা হৈছিল আৰু সেইবোৰ 'কেন্দ্ৰীয় স্নায়ুতন্ত্ৰৰ হতাশাজনক ঔষধৰ প্ৰভাৱৰ সৈতে সামঞ্জস্যপূৰ্ণ' আছিল। লগতে এইটোও উল্লেখ কৰা হৈছিল যে 'সংলগ্ন এনকেফেಲೋপেথী নাকচ কৰিব নোৱাৰি'।

question: মই যোৱাৰ পিছত মোৰ কি কি এপোইণ্টমেণ্ট আছে?
answer: আপোনাৰ ১২/০১/২০২০ তাৰিখে ইলেক্ট্ৰ’নিউৰ’মাই’গ্ৰাফী আৰু ১০/১১/২০২০ তাৰিখে মেদবহুলতাৰ বাহিৰৰ ৰোগী বিভাগত এটা ফলো-আপ এপোইন্টমেন্ট আছে। আপুনি ফিজিকেল থেৰাপী আৰু পুষ্টি দলৰ নিৰ্দেশনাসমূহো মানি চলিব লাগিব।
